item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Tuesday, December 31, 2024 at 11:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. U.S. Army Soldier Arrested in AT&T, Verizon Extortions (65 points | 15 comments)
2. Dog Aging Project (51 points | 19 comments)
3. Interesting Interview with DeepSeek's CEO (25 points | 7 comments)
4. I keep turning my Google Sheets into phone-friendly webapps (377 points | 110 comments)
5. Coconut by Meta AI – Better LLM Reasoning with Chain of Continuous Thought? (192 points | 57 comments)
6. I wrote a Game Boy Advance game in Zig (204 points | 67 comments)
7. Dumping Memory to Bypass BitLocker on Windows 11 (266 points | 158 comments)
8. Ruby-refrigerator: Freeze all core Ruby classes (64 points | 6 comments)
9. "A Course of Pure Mathematics" – G. H. Hardy (1921) [pdf] (214 points | 44 comments)
10. Debugging memory corruption: who the hell writes "2" into my stack? (25 points | 1 comment)
11. Colliding with the SHA prefix of Linux's initial Git commit (112 points | 35 comments)
12. App Should Have Been a Website (and Probably Your Game Too) (24 points | 32 comments)
13. Agentarium: Creating social simulations with AI Agents (18 points | 2 comments)
14. Lightstorm: Minimalistic Ruby Compiler (99 points | 13 comments)
15. What Happens to Relicensed Open Source Projects and Their Forks? (37 points | 10 comments)
16. Seyfert Galaxies (18 points | 1 comment)
17. Letting Language Models Write My Website (3 points | discuss)
18. Why it's hard to trust software, but you mostly have to anyway (19 points | 21 comments)
19. Learning Solver Design: Automating Factorio Balancers (195 points | 26 comments)
20. Beyond Gradient Averaging in Parallel Optimization (79 points | 24 comments)
21. Jack Elam and the Fly in 'Once Upon a Time in the West' (95 points | 18 comments)
22. Performance of LLMs on Advent of Code 2024 (96 points | 53 comments)
23. Short Message Compression Using LLMs (208 points | 96 comments)
24. LineageOS 22 Released (183 points | 79 comments)
25. Orbit by Mozilla (258 points | 249 comments)
26. Pee.ie – Public Toilets Near Me Ireland (26 points | 9 comments)
27. Coding Font Selection 'Tournament' (80 points | 61 comments)
28. Behind the Scenes: Alien Worlds – Jumpship over a tidally locked planet (55 points | 2 comments)
29. MiceWine – run Windows applications and games on Android smartphones (193 points | 57 comments)
30. Tell HN: John Friel my father, internet pioneer and creator of QModem, has died (940 points | 77 comments)
